title: Organic typeface
content:
Hi I'm looking for the name of the attached font and any recommended fonts for organic whole foods identity and typeface. We're going for a hand-draw organic feeling.

I appreciate all your help. -Chris

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101180108/http:/typophile.com/files/font_315.jpg) | 26.21 KB |
author: Relevant Logo

comments.content:
Sorry, don't know this one.  
Some in the same vein (slab/wide/hand-drawn/rough): [Antique Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101180108/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/archivetype/archive-antique-extended/), [Firenza](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101180108/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeart/firenza/), [Stud](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101180108/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/stud/), [Bandoliers](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101180108/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/bandoliers/), [Spur Rust](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101180108/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/open-window/spur-rust/), [Grandma](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101180108/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hvdfonts/grandma/)

Very similar to: Gerren Lamson HandSlab-Regular  
 [http://www.gerrenlamson.com/shop/handslab/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101180108/http:/www.gerrenlamson.com/shop/handslab/index.html)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150101180108im_/http:/typophile.com/files/foodie1_6412.jpg)

Very nice, great fonts Ryuk and thanks DPape for finding that, love it. I appreciate your help. If anyone else has any organic handmade fonts that would work well for whole foods please post.

Thanks,

Chris
